alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Broome and central Susquehanna Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hallstead, or 8 miles north of Montrose, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conklin, Jackson, Montrose, Harford, Hallstead, New Milford, Great Bend, Gibson, Brackney and Salt Springs State Park. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 230. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
